intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium insigne f. celsum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers and hairy, rough leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils in meadows and along stream banks. It is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, including North America. The subspecies 'celsum' is distinguished by its larger, more showy flowers compared to the typical form.
